qas.question: Which two groups of invertebrates have complex brains?

answers.text: arthropods (insects, crustaceans, arachnids, and others), and cephalopods

qas.question: Arthropods and cephalopods have brains that come from a pair of what?
The invertebrates with the largest brain are what two animals?

context: Two groups of invertebrates have notably complex brains: <a0_0>arthropods (insects, crustaceans, arachnids, and others), and cephalopods<a0_0/> (octopuses, squids, and similar molluscs). The brains of arthropods and cephalopods arise from twin <a1_0>parallel nerve cords<a1_0/> that extend through the body of the animal. Arthropods have a central brain with three divisions and large optical lobes behind each eye for visual processing. Cephalopods such as the <a2_0>octopus and squid<a2_0/> have the largest brains of any invertebrates.
